newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SKF targets car components market.
newsitem.headline: SKF targets car components market.

text.p: Swedish ballbearing company SKF AB is growing rapidly in the car components market which is now of top priority, company president Peter Augustsson said on Friday.

"We have a 15 percent share of deliveries to car manufacturing, but of the car component market we only have eight-nine percent today. Why should it be that way?" Augustsson said in an interview with Reuters.
"Therefore we are focusing on new marketing channels on all our markets."
The car component market and the industrial after-market are profitable businesses.
"On the industrial after-market we already have a strong position today and we are strengthening it through improving logistics," Augustsson said.
An important part in that improvement is SKF's new central storage facility for the after-market in Belgium.
Next week, Germany will be connected to the European logistics system and regional storages in the country can be eliminated.
"Currently, the central storage supplies customers from Finland to Greece," he said.
SKF will launch a similar logistics system in the U.S.. The large storage facility in Knoxville, Tennessee is part of the initial stages of the project.
